thread.title: CFPB Study Finds Electronic Mortgage Closings Can Benefit Consumers
thread.title_full: CFPB Study Finds Electronic Mortgage Closings Can Benefit Consumers

author: Orrick - Structured Finance Group
title: CFPB Study Finds Electronic Mortgage Closings Can Benefit Consumers
text:
<iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=466e2091-d5d7-4362-bb10-61f2bc438365" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 
On August 4, the CFPB published a report on its “Know Before You Owe” eClosing project which found that borrowers can benefit from electronic closings when navigating the mortgage closing process. Specifically, the results of the pilot indicate that those who closed their mortgage using an electronic platform are generally better off on measures of understanding, efficiency, and feeling empowered than borrowers who used just paper forms. Release . Report
